H0.text: A geometric pattern formed by a mineral is a fossil.

H1.text: A solid element or compound from Earth's crust is the best description of a fossil.

H2.text: Remains of an extinct organism found in a rock layer are a fossil.

H3.text: Bits of weathered rocks and pieces of dead organisms are the best description of a fossil.

A4.text: Cuvier is generally regarded as the first paleontologist, and the origins of paleontology as a science trace their origins directly to his demonstrations that fossils in stone were traces of organisms that were once alive but had gone extinct.

A5.text: Most fossils are made up of the hard parts of an organism that have been recrystallized by minerals, preserving bone, wood, or shells in a material than can be harder or denser than in life.
